It is the seller's responsibility to bring the following items to the closing:

options.text: He is entitled to cross examine witnesses.
He is entitled to an attorney.
He is entitled to expenses incurred if found innocent.
He is entitled to the $5,000 to defray costs.

questions.question: The Chairperson for the Real Estate Board is selected by the:
If a Rental Agent charges a fee to prospective tenants, the agent must:

options.text: Provide the seller with a list of all names of prospective tenants.
Provide the buyer with a fee disclosure form.
Provide the seller with a fee disclosure form.
Provide the state with copies of all paperwork.

questions.question: An individual who is purchasing a commercial property is requesting information about the environmental condition of the property. He/She would be looking for:

John listed a property for sale. The seller did not fill out a property disclosure statement. Two weeks after John began marketing the property the seller told him that a murder occurred in the house six months ago. In this case, John:

options.text: Must disclose the murder to prospective buyers.
Must disclose the murder to the real estate agents in his office.
Is not allowed to disclose the information to the buyer unless specifically asked about it.
Is not allowed to disclose the information at all.

questions.question: The seller of a property is required to bring the following to the passing of papers:

options.text: A Certification of Title signed by the Registrar of Deeds.
A Smoke Detector Certificate signed by the local fire chief.
A Mortgage Discharge signed by the mortgagee.
A Bill of Sale for the property.

questions.question: A buyer asked a real estate agent if there is ledge under a property. The agent lets the buyer know that several houses in the area were built on ledge. In this case, the buyer may want to have what type of test?
John has offered property for sale that is not located within the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. Which of the following situations are not true?

options.text: He must obtain approval from the board before offering the property for sale.
He must give prospective buyers a copy of a report published by the board.
He must retain a receipt indicating he gave the buyer a report.
He must pay an agent located within the state that the property is located a commission for showings.

questions.question: Jane is offering property for sale located outside the Commonwealth of Massachusetts. She received a sales contract from a buyer and forwarded to them a copy of the report published by the board. In this situation, Jane:

options.text: Conducted the transaction appropriately because she gave them a copy of the report.
Acted inappropriately because she gave them a copy of the report.
Acted inappropriately because she received a contract before giving them a copy of the report.
Will lose her license if acted inappropriately.

questions.question: A Broker could lose their license for the following reasons:

options.text: Receiving a commission from the seller and buyer without the consent and knowledge of both parties.
Giving an unlicensed friend a referral fee.

questions.question: If John, a sole proprietor, passed away, which of the following situations would be valid regarding a temporary license?

options.text: The licensee must have real estate experience.
The licensee must be a relative of John.
The licensee can be anyone designated by the board.
The licensee must pass the state test within 6 months.

questions.question: James is operating as a salesperson without a license. He obtained his license before the closing took place. In this situation, who is owed a commission for the sale?

options.text: Efficient and procuring cause of the sale.
No one is due a commission.

questions.question: In this situation, who does not need a real estate license?
The Massachusetts Housing Finance Agency (MHF A) (known as Mass Housing) does the following:

options.text: Assists low income buyers purchase homes.

questions.question: When the Governor signs a law that effects the real estate profession, the change is in effect:

options.text: For five years, then it must be renewed.
It is a permanent part of the law unless changed by the legislative.

questions.question: Real Estate Licensing law prohibits one of the following:

options.text: Using the buyer's downpayment to defray costs.

questions.question: The Real Estate Board meets at the following location four times a year:
The chairperson of the board is selected:
Broker Jane is the owner of a real estate office. She hires Broker Judy to work at the office. The Real Estate Board needs to be aware of the following information:

options.text: The Errors and Emissions Company for the two Brokers.
The home addresses of Jane and Judy.
The compensation agreement between Jane and Judy.
The business relationship between Jane and Judy.

questions.question: Broker Joe could be subject to disciplinary action for failure to:

options.text: Inform the board about the real estate agents working in his office.
Place deposit funds in an escrow account.
Place a copy of real estate licenses for the agents working in his office in a conspicuous place.

questions.question: The reason for a broker to maintain an escrow account would be:

options.text: To protect the seller and buyer.
To follow a state mandated law.

questions.question: Joe Smith, the employing broker with ABC Realty, and Jim Smith, a sales agent within the office, come to an agreement with Joe Sales to sell his property. Which situation is correct?

options.text: The commission is set by the National Association of Realtors.
The commission is agreed upon by all the parties involved.

questions.question: If yourself and three of your friends decide to open a Realty Brokerage Corporation, the following must occur:

options.text: You must obtain a bond for $10,000.
You must designate each person as a member of the Board of Directors.
You must get a broker's license in the corporation name.
You must inform all potential sellers and buyers about the ownership status.

questions.question: If yourself and three of your friends opened a Realty Brokerage Corporation, how many people need to have a broker's license in their own name?
If an agent is found guilty of violating Fair Housing laws by the Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination, the Board would:

options.text: Conduct a hearing to determine a course of action.
Begin an investigation to determine license status.

questions.question: Which of the following violations result in an automatic loss of a real estate license?
If a non-resident desired to practice real estate in Massachusetts, they must meet which of the following obligations?

options.text: Practice real estate for 2,000 hours before applying for a license.
File a Power of Attorney with the State Board.
Obtain a broker's license within 30 days.

questions.question: Broker Sue would like to offer property for sale that is not located in Massachusetts. Which of the following is not a requirement?

options.text: The State Board will hold a public hearing to decide whether the offering will be allowed.
Broker Sue must apply for permission to market the property.
The state will charge Broker Sue for the cost to inspect the property.
Broker Sue will pay for the cost of a publication by the Commonwealth of Massachusetts that will approve the offering.

questions.question: James Smith is the sole proprietor of his business. He passed away after 20 years in business. Which situation would be true?

options.text: Because James died as a sole proprietor, his business no longer exists.
The state can grant a temporary license to someone to continue to operate up to one year.
The state will allow the business to continue if another broker worked in the office.
The state will issue a temporary license to continue to operate for up to two years.

questions.question: Which of the following situations would be true about a temporary licensee?

options.text: The temporary licensee must have one year experience since they are now managinga real estate company.
The temporary licensee must be related to the former owner.
The temporary licensee can be anyone as long as approved by the state board.
The temporary licensee can renew the license.

questions.question: In a Real Estate advertisement, a broker is required to:

options.text: Disclose the APR in the ad.
Indicate the company name in the ad.

questions.question: Property taxes that are due semi- annually would be due on:
Property taxes that are due quarterly are due on:
Sandy received her annual tax bill and believes it is too much money. Sandy can do the following:

options.text: Apply for an abatement and then pay the taxes.
Pay the taxes and then apply for an abatement.
Pay half the taxes up front before an abatement hearing.
Pay nothing until the abatement status is posted.

questions.question: A person who works in a real estate office as an unlicensed assistant can do the following:

options.text: Take an apartment listing from a property owner.
Provide information to buyers over the telephone.

questions.question: For what purpose does the state mandate a non-resident file a Power of Attorney with the Real Estate Board?

options.text: To inform the board about the owner of a property.
In case of an accident at the property.
To provide the board with legal notice involving litigation to the property.
To provide the board with knowledge regarding the buyers.

questions.question: Broker Jane and Agent Jim are real estate professionals in Boston. Broker Jane is the listing agent of a property, and Agent Jim is the selling agent for that property. Agent Jim has not met the seller of the property, and Broker Jane has not met the buyer of the property. There are not any contractual agreements between Agent Jim and the buyer. What is the relationship status?

options.text: Broker Jane is a sub- agent of Agent Jim.
Broker Jane and Agent Jim represent the seller.
Broker Jane and Agent Jim represent the buyer and seller.

questions.question: When is an agent required to provide a potential buyer with an agency disclosure form?

options.text: When the buyer makes an offer on a property
When they first meet to discuss specific properties

questions.question: An agent who is writing up an offer on a property represented the seller. The buyer requested a list of home inspectors. In this situation, the agent can:

options.text: Provide a few names because the buyer asked.
Provide a list of inspectors located in the town.
Provide a list of the top rated inspectors.
Provide a list that includes every home inspector in the Commonwealth.

questions.question: Is a buyer of a two-family home built prior to 1978 allowed to waive the lead paint inspection?

options.text: No, because it was built before 1978, the test is mandatory.
Yes, the buyer is not required to test for lead.
Yes, as long as the buyer knows it is a requirement to remove the lead.
No, because if lead is found the seller is required to remove it.

questions.question: The form required to be signed by a seller, agent and buyer regarding lead paint is:

options.text: Your Rights as a Consumer Bulletin

options.text: Tell the sellers to fix the defects.
Disclose to future buyers the defects found.
Do nothing because the buyer must have their own inspection.
Do nothing because they represent the seller.

questions.question: Joe is purchasing a two-family property. The unit he intends to rent has lead paint. In this case, which is true?

options.text: Joe can turn down prospective tenants with children because he owner occupies the property.
Joe cannot turn someone away because they have children.
Joe must not rent the apartment until the lead is removed.
Joe must sue the seller for not telling him about the lead.
